Package planeair.importation

Class FIGImportation

java.lang.Object
planeair.importation.FIGImportation
public abstract class FIGImportation extends Object
This class contains all the functions/procedures linked to FIG importation.
In this project, two types of files are mainly used :
  1. "aeroports.csv" contains all data of the Airports, which will be stored in an AirportSet.
  2. "vols-testX.csv" contains all data of the Flights we wish to simulate. The Flights NEEDS the Airports, and need to be imported after them.
The files are formated due to certain rules, in order to find the right informations at the right place. So, if a file can't be read because of some errors (mistakes or not), it may endanger the entire application.
In order to prevent such a mess to happen, data will be checked before to be fully imported in the application's objects. Messages will be prompt for the user, even if these errors are not blocking the programm to execute. With that, the user will be informed of all the errors that are present in the files.
Author:
Luc le grand, que dis-je, le Manifik

  • Field Details

    • REGEX_FIG

      public static final String REGEX_FIG
      The RegEx which is used to clean the lines of the files. It only accepts ";", numbers and letters. All the other caracters are ignored.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      public static final String REGEX_NUMBERS

  • Method Details

    • importAirportsFromFile

      public static void importAirportsFromFile(AirportSet airportSet, File airportsFile) throws FileNotFoundException, InvalidFileFormatException
      Imports the Airports from a File passed in parameter. They are automatically added to the AirportSet.
      Parameters:
      airportSet - the set in which they will be added
      airportsFile - The source File File
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - Thrown if the source File is not found or does not exist
      InvalidFileFormatException - Thrown if the File is not found or does not exist

    • importFlightsFromFile

      public static void importFlightsFromFile(AirportSet airportSet, FlightsIntersectionGraph fig, File flightsFile) throws FileNotFoundException, InvalidFileFormatException
      Imports and creates Flights from the source file passed in parameter. The Airports which are needed to create the Flights are in the AirportSet, passed in parameter. It is made this way so that we can create multiple FIG without having to re-import the Airports each time.
      Parameters:
      airportSet - The util.AirportSet AirportSet that contains all the Airports.
      fig - The FIG which contains all the Flights
      flightsFile - The source java.io.File File where the informations on the Flights are stored.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - Thrown if the file is not found or does not exist.
      InvalidFileFormatException - Thrown if the source File does not matches the expected format.

    • reDoCollisions

      public static void reDoCollisions(FlightsIntersectionGraph fig, int securityMargin)
      Recalculates the collections of this graph with the new security margin
      Parameters:
      fig - the fig being redone
      securityMargin - the new security margin
